title: Guatemala: Citi Grants Academic Excellence Awards
summary: Guatemala City, Guatemala - Promoting community development is one of Citi's commitments around the world. In Guatemala, as part of its efforts to promote the education of the country's young people, Citi Guatemala organized the fourth annual Citi Academic Excellence Awards, honoring 63 high school and college students for earning a grade-point average of 85 or above in 2013.
tag-1: Guatemala: Citi Grants Academic Excellence Awards
tag-3: Guatemala City, Guatemala – Promoting community development is one of Citi's commitments around the world. In Guatemala, as part of its efforts to promote the education of the country's young people, Citi Guatemala organized the fourth annual Citi Academic Excellence Awards, honoring 63 high school and college students for earning a grade-point average of 85 or above in 2013.
tag-4: The Citi Academic Excellence Awards offers partial scholarships to students who excel in Universidad Francisco Marroquin's Academic Impulse Program and the basic, technical and diversified programs at Fundación Kinal and Centro Educativo Benito Juarez.
tag-5: The partial scholarships allow college students to continue their studies and for high school students to graduate with a degree.
tag-6: In addition to the scholarship and the recognition, the students will have the opportunity to meet with Citi Guatemala volunteers for career advice and a chance to apply for an internship at the bank.
tag-7: "Promoting education among young people is part of our commitment to responsible finance," explained Bernardo Chacín, General Director of Citi Guatemala. "Our goal is to help the country train new talent, and we know that investing in the education of children and young people is indispensable. We believe that young people who are responsible and excel in their studies often go on to be talented and highly trained adults in their professional careers."
tag-8: The awards honored a total of 63 young people who had a grade point average of 85 or above and demonstrated responsibility and academic excellence.
tag-9: "This recognition is like being offered a soda in the desert," commented Catherine Cifuentes, a student at Universidad Francisco Marroquin. "When your hard work, effort and application are rewarded, you feel like that soda in the desert gives you the motivation to be even better, to forge ahead and aim your sights much higher than you had originally planned. Academic excellence is a quality that must be maintained through focus, dedication, perseverance and, above all, recognition. Thank you for contributing to my academic excellence!"
